Extn : 2223 2318 2468 2553 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Shipping, Road Transport and Highways) #t-5 & 6, 77z-10, â‚¬RGT, 7f faoai-110 075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, Delhi-110075 No.= 11041/218/2007-Admn. 04 .05.2009 POLICY MATTERS TECHNICAL (26/2009) (Decision taken on Finance Division note NHAI/Coord/4/2009) Sub: The ongoing project award process: In the ongoing award process related 60 projects taken up during 2008-09, single bids in respect of 7 projects (Phase-III 4 Phsae-V 1, Phase-II and other PPP Projects-2) were received_ Bids in respect of three projects for Phase-V were not considered reasonable. 2 Committee of Secretaries in their meeting held on 26.03.2009 had decided as follows, NHAI may consider restructuring the projects which have received single bids under BOT mode, with the aim to reduce the project cost to the extent possible without compromising on safety measures and re-bid them with reduced cost to enable better response from prospective bidders. (i) NHAI may consider restructuring of projects under NHDP Phase-V to enhance their financial viability so that VGF to be sought by the bidders in the re-bid process for these projects may be minimized. The PPPAC may consider whether the 10% stipulation should be revised under certain conditions and in certain areas in order to ensure viability of the projects. 3 Hence pursuant to the directions of DoRTH issued vide letter No. RWINH-37012/3/2009- PPP dated 21.04.2009 (copy enclosed) following has been decided with approval of Chairman , In case of project where no bids or single bids have been received, re-structuring of the project to be carried out and then offered to all the pre-qualified bidders. Eastern Peripheral Expressway will be outside the purview of the aforesaid instructions. 4 The above may kindly be taken note of by all concerned for immediate action. shxy (S.K: Nirmal) General Manager (Coord ) To: 1.
